#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Pricasso : No particular reason on my behalf , it was the organisers of the Sexpo who got me to paint it mainly for publicity .
#Text=But also to have a portrait on my stand , who people in Cape Town would relate to as I now know she is very popular and has a great sense of humour .
#Text=Cape Town former-Mayor Helen Zille Image : Helen Zille , Democratic Alliance , South Africa .

#Text=( ( WN ) ) Mayor of Cape Town Helen Zille commented of your portrait painting of her : " This is a free country . A free society throws up these kinds of people , who exercise their freedom in unusual ways . And if this is how he wants to do it , I must accept his constitutional right to do so . " — what are your thoughts on her reaction ?

#Text=Pricasso : Sounds a bit formal but that is how politicians usually talk , guarded and a totally correct response , the trouble is that if they spoke from the heart it might come back to bite them one day , but I did talk to one of her aides privately and she said they were all really impressed and loved the concept , I really should have offered to paint her too but I was probably flat out all day — I always am at the South African shows .

#Text=( ( WN ) ) Mayor Zille further commented about the quality of your painting of her : " [ Pricasso ] has achieved a good likeness and I ca n't imagine how he painted it without brushes or conventional equipment . " — what do you think of this assessment ?
#Text=Pricasso :

#Text=Most people are impressed when they see it done , skeptical at first but after the initial shock they all usually stop to watch until I finish that particular painting , usually they take about 15 minutes .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) If you could speak to Mayor Zille , what would you say to her about her reaction to your painting of her ?
#Text=Pricasso : I would say I was impressed with her response , mostly girls are much more impressed than guys only a minority of guys I might add , lots of them love it and me too ! !
#Text=But in general she gave a responsible and educated reply and was not at all offended by the experience .

#Text=( ( WN ) ) In 2011 , one member of the Gold Coast Sculptors ' Society quit in protest due to your participation in the ' Exotic Erotic ' show — how do you feel when people react to your artwork in this way ?
#Text=Pricasso : I guess I could say ; This is a free country .
#Text=A free society throws up these kinds of people , who exercise their dissaproval in various ways .
#Text=And if this is how she wants to protest , I must accept her constitutional right to do so .
#Text=There was that politically correct enough ?
#Text=Or maybe the silly old B***ch — but her reaction did get heaps of publicity for the show and they had record numbers coming through the doors so there was a silver lining .
#Text=But obviously it is a bit confronting and not everyone 's cup of tea but if they could just see it before they get on their high horse they might have a different point of view .
